intro: Polakowskia tacaco, commonly known as the Tacaco polka, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of Ecuador. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its striking, colorful flowers that resemble small polka dots, hence its common name. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soil. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
